I have an xp farm, and if I am working in the relative area, 700-1200 entities build up and it takes a lot of time to collect all that experience... During that time I only get 1.5 seconds per frame. This is on a 4770k, GTX 960 event with the Fabric mod Sodium.

this needs to be added in, as more and more farms are producing xp, i think this should be the solution albeit maybe not now, but some day.

different orb sizes to show how much xp (at a glace) the orb will give should be something like X*3 per orb where x is the size below and all orbs will then merge in to the smallest number of orbs for the total xp on the ground(i do believe that one or more mods does this for java, will leave unnamed) 

 

so based on the x*3 would be 1, 3, 9, 27, 81, 243, 729, 2187 xp per orb
I agree but I do one only request: please clean the repeated text.

New Block: Symmetrical 'Swing' Doors

I love symmetrical builds.

However, sometimes I prefer the dimensions of my builds to be odd numbered, mostly so I can get pointy roofs. lol

However, when builds are odd-numbered, the front door always stands out as unsymmetrical (both it's door handle and it's open position).

I've always hated the fact that odd-numbered buildings can't truly be symmetrical because of just this one block.

So I propose the introduction of a brand new type of door block, that is the same size as the current door, however is 'cut' down the middle and attached to the blocks (door frame) either side of it, similar to iconic 'swing' doors from those old-fashioned 'Saloons' in Classic Western movies.

So it would open and close just like the fence gate block.

And it would come in the same six varieties of wood that the current doors are available in.

This way, whether we prefer to build in odd or even numbers, the entrances of our builds can remain symmetrical. :)

 

Here is an illustration of what they could look like:

https://ibb.co/55GCyry

 

Some nice texture designs by Imagopher in the comments:

https://imgur.com/a/l6CMq6E

 

Original Reddit Post: https://www.reddit.com/r/minecraftsuggestions/comments/bkgs8q/new_block_symmetrical_swing_doors/

I totally agree!

(Seb 103, could you make a new post instead of a comment here?)
It should also have a brick variant and both should have blocks, stairs and slabs.

The “Cliffs” part of the Caves and Cliffs Update (The real update that changed the World) is a good time to add limestone, as limestone can be found as massive cliffs on the coastline in real life. Limestone also appears underground too, so maybe a new biome called the Limestone Caves, perhaps? They can spawn both on dry land and underwater, as limestone also forms deposits underwater. Structures called Limestone Deposits can also be found underwater, where players can mine limestone for building and other purposes.
we were promised  limestone
Hey congrats on being ahead of the trend - they might not be greyish white but there is certainly fungal wood coming soon!

I basically want the sticks to blend in with the planks you used, it's a simple change and I really don't see a HUGE reason of why it should have an use, I think maybe it would a cool thing added to the game similar to how different wood types of buttons and trapdoors were interesting.
No problem :)

The issue with this is that sticks are almost exclusively used for crafting, not decorating or building. So this would not add to the aesthetic possibilities of Minecraft in any significant way, unlike trapdoors or buttons, which actually can be used in builds.

In addition, sometimes it's nice to be able to use up two loose planks of different species by turning them into sticks. Interesting idea, but no support from me.
Don't you think it would be nice to have birch sticks so you can have a birch handle to your diamond sword instead of the boring oak all the time.
Interesting. Might be good to change item frame borders but it would mostly be an inconvenience for crafting and for not much purpose. It takes away a lot more than it adds. But it has potential.
The reason this feature is important is because we NEED variants for ladders, which use only sticks in their recipe. This way there can be new ladder variants without changing the recipe.
What is the different sticks affected the hilts of your tool though?

When tools are made with the same color stick, they would obviously have the same color handle. But, if two sticks of different color are used, they could either change to the default color, randomly choose either color, or do a combination of both
The gold anvil would break in 2 or 3 uses.

Same here, was so excited to see how i could make designs but the items were too small to look nice or even like a design at all. I really hope that mojang makes the items in the shelves appear like they do on bedrock.
Agreed. The current implementation is not very good for decoration, and even from a purely functional standpoint it's difficult to make out what items are in a shelf.

No one asked for them to be smaller, even there was people complaining about them being too small. Community overall loved the details and decorations we could do with them and all Mojang decided to be the most coherent decision was to make them EVEN smaller and siting at the bottom? 💀 What?

Hope the developers hear our complainings
I hope they go back to the larger, centered design.
Yes please. This is a sorely needed addition.

I'm tired of spending 5 planks for a block that is literally 3/4ths the size of 1 block of planks. Trapdoors make more sense. Slabs are the correct amount of 3 planks->6 slabs. Why are stairs so expensive for no reason? Please implement this. It would take no time just change the textures of the stonecutter, change the block input/output options. Could be done in a day.

One plant I'd be really in favor of is the butterwort. Most people don't seem to know about them, so it'd be good if they got some recognition. To sum them up, butterworts are basically aquatic carnivorous plants that produce beautiful yellow flowers on stalks at their surface, while below have pouch-like organs located on their roots that suck in and digest very small aquatic animals. And while I don't think they should display that carnivorous behavior ingame, it'd still be a unique and very fitting plant to see in the swamps.
Also maybe allegy, the wild update needs more plants, great idea.

Another post suggested adding in weeping willow trees to the swamp, and I think that concept fits well with your idea (all of the following bits though are just my take on willow trees though). Visually I imagine they'd have drooping leaves and vines (maybe thick ones like the glowberry vines) and they could have a grey-tinted wood (both planks and logs). These would spawn with (if not in the place of) the oak trees in swamps (excluding the mangrove swamps) and would provide an additional color for planks since many people want more wood types. They would spawn perhaps 2-5 blocks away from a water source and would grow 10-15 blocks tall since willow trees are fairly tall in real life.

Ice Cream Cones

Cones are kind of like a sweet bread/cookie. So maybe Wheat and Sugar should make up the recipe. Something like:

Legend: W = Wheat, S = Sugar, - = Nothing

- S -            - -  -

- W -   OR   - S -

- W -          - W -
It's a medieval fantasy game.

Ice cream is not a modern invention. It has been around for centuries, just not as the fluffy, cloudlike frozen treat we've come to love and enjoy. So the idea of having Ice Cream in Minecraft does not stray from the 'Medieval Fantasy' theme of Minecraft.
